resources.string: The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970. It is the best-known example of a cellular automaton.
Map the rate of survival to distinct colors
Any live cell with fewer than the minimum number of live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population
Any live cell with more than the maximum number of live neighbours dies, as if caused by over-population
Any dead cell with exactly the spawn number of live cells becomes a live cell
Control how fast the game progresses. Faster animation speed means each generation will live for a shorter amount of time before being replaced by the next generation.
